results.title: Ballet in New Zealand
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Cyril Morton and Robert Lapresle
results.brief_description: The standard of ballet in New Zealand is shown in excerpts from four works - ‘Napoli’, ‘Do-wack-a-do’, ‘Les Sylphides’, ‘Prismatic variations’. A good representative selection which shows competence, imagination and enthusiasm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Zealand National Film Unit, Geoffrey Scott, Cyril Morton and Robert Lapresle

results.title: Ballet girl
results.brief_description: This film follows a small girl at the Royal Danish Ballet School. Follows her awakening interest in ballet, her entrance test, ballet classes and school lessons, her admiration of the older students and her progress to her first school ballet concert.
results.description: This film follows a small girl at the Royal Danish Ballet School. Follows her awakening interest in ballet, her entrance test, ballet classes and school lessons, her admiration of the older students and her progress to her first school ballet concert.

results.title: Ballet class with Madame Ninette de Valois
results.brief_description: A senior students’ class at the Royal Ballet School, is directed through a series of barre, centre and pointe exercises by Madame De Valois.

results.title: Ballet by Degas
results.creator_credit: George Jacobson, Mavis Lyons and J.H. Lenauer
results.brief_description: Studies of a number of the ballet paintings by Edgar Degas (1834-1917): “The Ballet Class”, “Coryphee Resting”, “Ballerina and the Lady with the Fan”, all from the Philadelphia Museum of Art, and “On Stage”, “Dancers Practising at the Bar”, and “Pink and Green” from the collection of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

results.title: Ballet Black
results.brief_description: Formed in 1946, Ballet Negres was the first all black dance company in Europe. It reached its creative and popular peak between 1948 and 1950 but by 1952 it had dissolved. The company created a unique style, fusing Afro Carribean dance with classical ballet. It used mime as a third distinctive element to develop a narrative reflecting Black/White relations and Black folklore. The film explores the Ballet Negres story, using reviews, news coverage and showing a reunion of the original members. Young dancers are also seen rehearsing and performing the ballet “They Came”.

results.title: Ballet adagio
results.brief_description: A slow motion study by Norman McLaren of the pas-de-deux adagio, one of the most exacting and difficult dances of the classical ballet. A ballet originally choreographed by the Russian ballet master Asaf Messerer is performed in this film by the internationally known Canadian pair David and Anna Marie Holmes, to the music of Albinoni’s “Adagio”. A film to heighten the aesthetic appreciation of classical ballet and to afford observation of the technique and mechanics of the adagio movements. Photographed by Jaques Fogel and Douglas Kiefer. (Awards: Melbourne, Atlanta, Columbus, Bogota)

results.title: Ballerina
results.brief_description: A film portrait of Margaret Mercier, graduate of Sadler’s Wells Ballet, prima ballerina of Les Grands Ballets Canadiens, Montreal and a student of the Bolshoi Ballet. She tells her own story in this film - how she feels about the demands of her art, the dedication, energy, work and persistence that it requires.

results.title: Ballads of Bullant Ridge. No. 2
results.creator_credit: Academy Film Productions, Ronald Mason and Alan Marshall
results.brief_description: Alan Marshall stories set to traditional Australian bush music and illustrated by cartoonist Douglas Trainsh. The items featured are your nose’ and ‘The Ghost of Captain Candlelight’.

results.title: Ballads of Bullant Ridge. No. 1
results.creator_credit: Academy Film Productions, Ronald Mason and Alan Marshall
results.brief_description: A series of bush ballad songs based on the “Speewa Jack” characters from the Alan Marshall stories illustrated by cartoonist Douglas Trainsh. The songs are ‘The Strongest man in town’; ‘The Boxing kangaroo’; and ‘Goanna oil’.

results.title: Ballade Pour Un Voyou = Ballad for a Scoundrel
results.brief_description:
An ex-convict is recruited to deliver a suitcase whose contents are coveted by a variety of secret agents. When he runs off with the suitcase, the local police grab his girlfriend to ensure the safe delivery of the secret contents. The spies, police and free lance adventure seekers all go after the man and his coveted package. He must decide whether or not to blow up the contents when faced with a showdown with the authorities.

Credits: Producer, Jean Thuillier ; director, Jean-Claude Bonnardot ; writers, Jean-Claude Bonnardot, Jacqueline Sundstrom, Alexandre Tabor ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Samson Francois.
Cast: Laurent Terzieff, Hildergarde Neff, Philippe Noiret, Michel Vitold, Daniel Emilfork, Etienne Bierry.
